response_text:
{
  "conversation": [
    {
      "turn_id": 1,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:05",
      "text": "Hello, I’m one of the medicine residents. I know you just came up from the emergency department. Can you tell me in your own words what brought you in today?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","ADM#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 2,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:06",
      "text": "I had dialysis earlier. I got home and was lying on the couch, and all of a sudden I felt really weak and lightheaded. The room felt like it was spinning a bit. I couldn’t even get myself off the couch. I threw up once and then called 911 because I couldn’t get to the door.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 3,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:08",
      "text": "So this started after you finished your dialysis and got home, and the main things were weakness, lightheadedness, and one episode of vomiting. Any fever, chills, chest pain, shortness of breath, cough, belly pain, or diarrhea?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000001","DX#000005"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 4,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:09",
      "text": "No fevers or chills. No chest pain or trouble breathing. My stomach’s okay, no diarrhea or pain. Just that one time I threw up. Mostly I just felt so weak and dizzy.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 5,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:11",
      "text": "In the emergency room your blood pressure was quite low at first, and they gave you some IV fluids and an antibiotic called Zosyn just in case there was an infection. Your blood pressure has come up since then. Do you remember anyone mentioning that to you?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","PHARM#000001","PHARM#000012","RAD#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 6,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:12",
      "text": "They said my pressure was low and they were giving me fluids and some strong medicine for infection, but they didn’t find anything specific. I usually run low after dialysis anyway.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 7,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:14",
      "text": "You’re right, you told us your blood pressure is usually in the 80s to 90s after dialysis. I also see you started a new medication, pregabalin—Lyrica—for your nerve pain two days ago, and you had balance problems with gabapentin in the past. Is that right?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000006","DX#000010"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 8,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:15",
      "text": "Yes, my doctor started me on Lyrica two days ago for the pain on the right side of my face and head. I didn’t like gabapentin before because it made me feel off balance. This feels kind of similar, just worse.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000006"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 9,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:17",
      "text": "That’s very helpful. We’re concerned that the Lyrica may be causing these symptoms, especially given your kidney disease. We’re going to stop that medication now. We’ll also keep an eye out for infection, but so far your chest X-ray looks clear and your blood work doesn’t show a clear source.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000005","RAD#000001","LAB#000015","LAB#000017","LAB#000021","LAB#000028","PHARM#000025"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 10,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:18",
      "text": "Okay, I don’t want to take that again if it’s making me feel like this. I just don’t want to have this pain all the time either.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000006"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 11,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:20",
      "text": "We’ll work on safer options for your nerve pain. For now, we’ll use other pain medicines and we’re planning to start a low-dose medication called duloxetine later, after talking with your outpatient doctors. We’ll also monitor your blood pressure and check your labs again in the morning.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","PHARM#000015","PHARM#000025","LAB#000037","LAB#000049","LAB#000056"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 12,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:21",
      "text": "Alright. My head still hurts on the right side like it always does from the shingles I had there. I just don’t want to feel so dizzy.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000006"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 13,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:23",
      "text": "We’ll give you something for the headache and keep checking on the dizziness. If you feel the room spinning again or feel worse, please call the nurse right away.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","PHARM#000014","PHARM#000015"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 14,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H+00:40",
      "text": "Hi, I’m your nurse tonight. I’m going to check your vital signs and get you settled. How are you feeling right now—still lightheaded?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 15,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:41",
      "text": "A little lightheaded when I sit up, but not as bad as before. Mostly just tired and my right head and eye area hurt like usual.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000006"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 16,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H+00:42",
      "text": "Your blood pressure is still on the low side but close to what the doctors say is normal for you after dialysis. I’ll bring you some acetaminophen for the pain, and you also have a stronger pain pill ordered if you need it.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","PHARM#000014","PHARM#000015","PHARM#000016"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 17,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+00:43",
      "text": "Okay, I’ll try the Tylenol first. Thank you.",
      "evidence_eids": ["PHARM#000014"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 18,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H+01:30",
      "text": "I’m the attending physician on the medicine team. I’ve reviewed your chart and the resident’s note. You came in with sudden lightheadedness and weakness after dialysis, with one episode of vomiting, and you recently started Lyrica. Is that correct?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000001","DX#000005","PHARM#000025"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 19,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+01:31",
      "text": "Yes, that’s right. It came on all of a sudden after I got home from dialysis. I started Lyrica two days ago.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000005","DX#000006"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 20,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H+01:33",
      "text": "Given your history of feeling off balance on gabapentin and the timing with Lyrica, we think this is most likely a side effect of that medication, possibly worsened by your kidney disease and low blood pressure after dialysis. We’ve stopped Lyrica and will not restart it. We’re also watching for infection, but your chest X-ray is clear and your initial labs don’t show a clear infection source.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000005","DX#000007","RAD#000001","LAB#000012","LAB#000021","LAB#000028","PHARM#000025"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 21,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+01:34",
      "text": "So you think it’s the Lyrica and not an infection? They scared me a bit in the ER talking about sepsis.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","PHARM#000012","PHARM#000013"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 22,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H+01:36",
      "text": "Right now, infection seems unlikely. You don’t have fever or localizing symptoms, your chest X-ray is normal, and your blood cultures so far show no growth. We started broad antibiotics at first because your blood pressure was low and you’re immunocompromised, but we’ve stopped them now that you’re stable and there’s no evidence of infection.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","RAD#000001","MICRO#000001","PHARM#000012","PHARM#000013","LAB#000035"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 23,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+01:37",
      "text": "Okay, that makes me feel better. I just want this dizzy feeling to go away so I can go home.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 24,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H+01:39",
      "text": "Our plan is to observe you, keep you hydrated, manage your pain, and make sure the lightheadedness improves off Lyrica. If you continue to feel better and your labs look okay, we’ll be able to send you home with some medication changes and follow-up.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","PHARM#000001","PHARM#000014","PHARM#000015","PHARM#000025"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 25,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+01:40",
      "text": "Will I still get my dialysis like usual while I’m here?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000005"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 26,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "H+01:41",
      "text": "Yes. You’re on a Monday, Wednesday, Friday schedule, and we’ll make sure you get hemodialysis here on your usual day. The nephrology team will see you and arrange it.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000005","PHARM#000020","PHARM#000022","PHARM#000023"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 27,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H+10:00",
      "text": "Good morning. I’m checking on you before your labs. How are the dizziness and weakness today compared to when you came in?",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 28,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+10:01",
      "text": "I still feel a little weak, but the spinning feeling is mostly gone. I can sit up without feeling like I’m going to pass out.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 29,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H+10:02",
      "text": "That’s good to hear. We’ll draw your morning blood work now to check your counts and kidney numbers, and the doctors will be by on rounds soon.",
      "evidence_eids": ["LAB#000001","LAB#000004","LAB#000012","LAB#000021","LAB#000028"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 30,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+12:50",
      "text": "We have your morning labs. Your blood counts show mild anemia and low platelets, similar to your baseline, and your white count is a bit low but stable. Your kidney numbers are higher than normal because you haven’t had dialysis yet—your creatinine is 8.1 and your potassium is 6.5, so we’re arranging dialysis for today.",
      "evidence_eids": ["LAB#000037","LAB#000038","LAB#000042","LAB#000045","LAB#000049","LAB#000054","LAB#000056","DX#000004","DX#000005"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 31,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+12:51",
      "text": "I figured my kidneys would be off since I missed my regular place. Is that potassium dangerous?",
      "evidence_eids": ["LAB#000049","LAB#000056","DX#000005"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 32,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+12:53",
      "text": "A potassium of 6.5 is higher than we like, but we caught it early and you’re going to dialysis shortly, which will bring it down. We’re also monitoring your heart rhythm. Right now your EKG and vital signs are stable.",
      "evidence_eids": ["LAB#000056","PHARM#000020","PHARM#000024","DX#000003"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 33,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+12:54",
      "text": "Okay. I don’t feel anything different in my heart, just the usual tiredness.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000003"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 34,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "H+12:56",
      "text": "That’s reassuring. The dialysis nurses will give you your usual medications during dialysis, including your vitamin D and some heparin for the machine. If you feel chest pain, palpitations, or worse dizziness during dialysis, tell them right away.",
      "evidence_eids": ["PHARM#000020","PHARM#000021","PHARM#000022","PHARM#000024","RX#000021","RX#000022","RX#000024"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 35,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+12:57",
      "text": "I will. I’ve had dialysis for a long time, so I know what to look out for.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000005"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 36,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H+13:10",
      "text": "They’re ready for you in dialysis. We’ll take you down now. You’ll get some of your medicines there, including something to help with itching and your bone health.",
      "evidence_eids": ["PHARM#000020","PHARM#000021","PHARM#000022","PHARM#000023"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 37,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+13:11",
      "text": "Okay. My skin has been so itchy, so anything that helps is good.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","PHARM#000004"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 38,
      "speaker": "CONSULT",
      "relative_time": "H+14:00",
      "text": "Hi, I’m from the nephrology team. We’re overseeing your dialysis today. We see you have ESRD from HIV-related kidney disease and dialyze three times a week. Today we’ll run your usual treatment and watch your blood pressure closely, since you came in with low pressures.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000005","PHARM#000020","PHARM#000022","PHARM#000023"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 39,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+14:01",
      "text": "Thanks. I usually feel wiped out after dialysis, but yesterday was worse than usual.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000005"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 40,
      "speaker": "CONSULT",
      "relative_time": "H+14:03",
      "text": "Understood. We’ll be conservative with how much fluid we remove today to avoid dropping your pressure too much. You’ll also get your usual medications through dialysis, like doxercalciferol and heparin, and we’ll recheck your labs afterward.",
      "evidence_eids": ["PHARM#000020","PHARM#000022","PHARM#000023","LAB#000049","LAB#000056"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 41,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+14:04",
      "text": "Alright. I’ll let you know if I feel funny.",
      "evidence_eids": []
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 42,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H+18:30",
      "text": "You’re back from dialysis. How are you feeling now?",
      "evidence_eids": ["PHARM#000020","PHARM#000022","PHARM#000023"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 43,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+18:31",
      "text": "Tired, like usual after dialysis, but not as dizzy as before. Just my regular headache and some itching.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000006","PHARM#000004"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 44,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "H+18:32",
      "text": "Your blood pressure is stable for you. I can bring you some hydroxyzine for the itching and acetaminophen or oxycodone for the headache if you’d like.",
      "evidence_eids": ["PHARM#000004","PHARM#000014","PHARM#000015"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 45,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "H+18:33",
      "text": "Hydroxyzine and a Tylenol would be good. I’ll save the stronger pill for later if I need it.",
      "evidence_eids": ["PHARM#000004","PHARM#000014"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 46,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 08:10",
      "text": "This morning, how are your lightheadedness and weakness compared to when you came in?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 47,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 08:11",
      "text": "Much better. I still feel a little weak, but I can stand up with help and I don’t feel like I’m going to fall over. The spinning is gone.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 48,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 08:13",
      "text": "That’s great. Your labs after dialysis show your potassium and kidney numbers are improving, and your blood pressure has been stable. We’re confident that stopping Lyrica helped. We’re planning to start duloxetine three times a week after dialysis for your nerve pain, at a low dose, and we’ll send you home on that.",
      "evidence_eids": ["LAB#000049","LAB#000056","DS#000001","PHARM#000025","RX#000025"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 49,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 08:14",
      "text": "Will that duloxetine make me dizzy like the Lyrica?",
      "evidence_eids": ["PHARM#000025"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 50,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 08:16",
      "text": "It can have side effects, but we’re using a low dose and only after dialysis to be safer with your kidneys. We’ll ask you to watch for any new dizziness or nausea and let your outpatient doctors know. We think it’s a better option than Lyrica or gabapentin for you.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","PHARM#000025"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 51,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 08:17",
      "text": "Okay, I’ll try it. I really need something for this nerve pain.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000006","PHARM#000025"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 52,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 10:00",
      "text": "We’re also keeping you on your prophylaxis medicines—azithromycin once a week and Bactrim three times a week—to protect you from infections related to your HIV. You’re not on your full HIV medications right now, but your outpatient infectious disease doctor is planning to restart them with blister packs after discharge.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000002","PHARM#000002","PHARM#000003","PHARM#000009","RX#000002","RX#000003","RX#000029"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 53,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 10:01",
      "text": "Yeah, they gave me blister packs but I haven’t started them yet. It’s a lot of pills and I get confused.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 54,
      "speaker": "ATTENDING",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 10:03",
      "text": "We understand. The team has gone through your medication list carefully because you weren’t sure of all the doses. We’ll send you home with a simplified list and recommend that you meet with a pharmacist as an outpatient to go over everything in detail.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","PHARM#000002","PHARM#000004","PHARM#000006","PHARM#000007","PHARM#000009","PHARM#000010"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 55,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 10:04",
      "text": "That would help. Sometimes I just don’t know what I’m supposed to be taking.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 56,
      "speaker": "CONSULT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 11:00",
      "text": "I’m from psychiatry. The team mentioned you’ve been feeling down. Can you tell me about your mood lately?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000010","DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 57,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 11:01",
      "text": "I’ve been pretty depressed. With all these health problems, it’s hard. But I’m not thinking about hurting myself.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000010","DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 58,
      "speaker": "CONSULT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 11:03",
      "text": "Thank you for sharing that. It’s important that you don’t have thoughts of harming yourself. We’ll recommend that you follow up with an outpatient psychiatrist after discharge to help manage your mood along with your medical issues.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000010","DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 59,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 11:04",
      "text": "Okay. I’d be willing to talk to someone.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DX#000010","DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 60,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 14:30",
      "text": "We’re getting close to sending you home. Your lightheadedness and weakness have improved, your blood pressure is back to your usual range, and your labs are stable for you. We’ve stopped Lyrica, started duloxetine for your nerve pain, and adjusted your kidney medications slightly.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","LAB#000037","LAB#000049","LAB#000056","PHARM#000025","RX#000025","RX#000027"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 61,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 14:31",
      "text": "So I can go home today?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 62,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 14:33",
      "text": "Yes, the plan is to discharge you home with visiting services. Your discharge diagnoses are lightheadedness likely from a medication side effect, along with your chronic conditions like AIDS and end-stage kidney disease. We’ll give you written instructions and a medication list.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000001","DX#000002","DX#000005","DX#000008","DX#000009"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 63,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 14:34",
      "text": "Can you go over which medicines I’m supposed to take when I get home?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 64,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 14:36",
      "text": "Of course. We want you to continue aspirin once a day, azithromycin once a week, Bactrim three times a week, sevelamer with meals three times a day, cinacalcet at a lower dose once a day, hydroxyzine as needed for itching, docusate twice a day for constipation, duloxetine three times a week after dialysis for nerve pain, and acetaminophen as needed for pain. We’ve stopped Lyrica.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","RX#000002","RX#000003","RX#000004","RX#000006","RX#000008","RX#000015","RX#000025","RX#000027"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 65,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 14:37",
      "text": "That’s a lot, but it helps to hear it. And I should not take Lyrica again, right?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","PHARM#000025"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 66,
      "speaker": "RESIDENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 14:38",
      "text": "Correct—do not take Lyrica again. If anyone tries to prescribe it, tell them you had dizziness and weakness from it. We’ll also put that in your chart.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000008","DX#000009"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 67,
      "speaker": "NURSE",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 15:10",
      "text": "I have your discharge papers here. They explain that your symptoms were most likely from a side effect of Lyrica, and they list all your medications and follow-up appointments. Do you have any questions before you go?",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","RX#000025"]
    },
    {
      "turn_id": 68,
      "speaker": "PATIENT",
      "relative_time": "HospitalDay2 15:11",
      "text": "No, I think I understand. I’ll follow up with my HIV doctor and dialysis center, and I’ll watch for dizziness. Thank you all for taking care of me.",
      "evidence_eids": ["DS#000001","DX#000002","DX#000005"]
    }
  ],
  "end_of_admission_summary": {
    "relative_discharge_time": "HospitalDay2 17:33",
    "one_paragraph_summary": "During this short observation admission, a middle-aged woman with advanced AIDS and ESRD on hemodialysis presented from home after dialysis with acute lightheadedness, weakness, and one episode of non-bloody, non-bilious vomiting, without fever or focal infectious symptoms.
